titleStmt.title: A true, sincere and modest defence, of English Catholiques that suffer for their faith both at home and abrode against a false, seditious and slanderous libel intituled; The exectuion of iustice in England. VVherein is declared, hovv vniustlie the Protestants doe charge Catholiques vvith treason ...
titleStmt.author: Allen, William, 1532-1594.

titleStmt.title: A true, sincere and modest defence, of English Catholiques that suffer for their faith both at home and abrode against a false, seditious and slanderous libel intituled; The exectuion of iustice in England. VVherein is declared, hovv vniustlie the Protestants doe charge Catholiques vvith treason ...
titleStmt.author: Allen, William, 1532-1594.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Cecil, William. The execution of justice in England for maintenaunce of publique and Christian peace.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
